Subjective: Neck spot, 2 weeks duration. Started after shaving, thought wart, now not. Scabs fall off occasionally. Insect bite at spot, causing swelling, redness. Itches. Feels uncomfortable if something sharp near it. No pain. No similar spots elsewhere. Knee pain, few months duration, after running, lingers for days; not severe. Impacts running/soccer. Family history: Father's side with sun-related skin problems (grandfather, uncles). No smoking/alcohol. Request: Wants diagnosis/treatment for neck spot, worried about skin cancer. Prefers freezing for removal.
Objective: Neck spot: Raised, ~0.5 cm, pinkish-red, slightly redder center. No scab visible. Neck: No lymphadenopathy. No other suspicious spots.
Assessment: Neck spot, susp. pyogenic granuloma vs. atypical mole. Rule out skin malignancy (patient concern). Chronic knee pain, post-exertional, unspecified.
Plan: Send picture to dermatologist via e-consultation.
Patient to call GP on Friday for advice (preferred before 10 AM or after 3 PM).
Discussed removal options: Freezing (liquid nitrogen, patient preference), Excision (with tissue analysis), Scraping (with tissue analysis).
Safety netting: Call GP if spot changes or worsens.
Knee pain: Make separate appointment if bothersome.
